scCulturePredict: Single-Cell Culture Media Prediction Package

Source: R/scCulturePredict-package.R
scCulturePredict-package.Rd

The scCulturePredict package provides dual functionality for analyzing single-cell RNA sequencing data to predict cell culture media conditions. The main function scCulture operates in two modes: "build" to generate transferable transcriptomic fingerprints from labeled training data, and "predict" to apply these fingerprints to unlabeled datasets. Individual functions are available for data loading, preprocessing, KEGG pathway analysis, and prediction using both similarity-based and machine learning approaches.

Details

The package offers two primary workflows:

**Build Mode** (mode = "build"):

  • Generate transferable fingerprints from labeled training data

  • Train similarity-based and SVM prediction models

  • Evaluate model performance with cross-validation

  • Save fingerprints and models for future use

**Predict Mode** (mode = "predict"):

  • Apply pre-built fingerprints to unlabeled datasets

  • Make culture media predictions using trained models

  • Calculate prediction confidence scores

  • Generate prediction-specific visualizations

**Core Functionalities**:

  • Data loading with support for CSV and 10X Genomics formats

  • Preprocessing including normalization and dimensionality reduction

  • KEGG pathway analysis and transcriptomic fingerprint generation

  • Dual prediction approaches: similarity-based and SVM machine learning

  • Comprehensive evaluation and visualization tools

For most users, the recommended approach is to use the scCulture function which handles both build and predict workflows with a single function call.

Main Pipeline

The scCulture function provides dual-mode functionality:

**Build Mode Pipeline**:

  • Loads and preprocesses labeled training data

  • Performs dimensionality reduction (PCA, UMAP, optional t-SNE)

  • Conducts KEGG pathway analysis and builds fingerprints

  • Trains similarity-based and SVM prediction models

  • Evaluates model performance with comprehensive metrics

  • Saves transferable fingerprints and trained models

  • Creates training evaluation visualizations

**Predict Mode Pipeline**:

  • Loads pre-built fingerprints and trained models

  • Loads and preprocesses unlabeled target data

  • Applies fingerprints to generate pathway profiles

  • Makes predictions using trained models

  • Calculates prediction confidence scores

  • Creates prediction-specific visualizations

  • Saves prediction results and confidence metrics

Data Loading

The load_data function provides robust data loading capabilities:

  • Supports both shell script and R-based file preparation

  • Automatic handling of malformed input files

  • Seamless integration with Seurat objects

Preprocessing

The preprocessing functions (preprocess_data, reduce_dimensions) handle data normalization and dimensionality reduction.

KEGG Analysis

KEGG pathway analysis is performed using parse_kegg_keg and build_fingerprints functions.

Prediction

Cell type/state prediction can be done using either similarity-based (predict_by_similarity) or SVM-based (predict_by_svm) approaches.

Evaluation

Results can be evaluated and visualized using evaluate_predictions, create_evaluation_plots, and create_evaluation_metrics_plot functions.

See also

scCulture for complete analysis pipeline (recommended) plot_scCulture for visualization of results load_data for data loading preprocess_data for data preprocessing reduce_dimensions for dimensionality reduction parse_kegg_keg for KEGG pathway analysis predict_by_similarity for similarity-based prediction predict_by_svm for SVM-based prediction evaluate_predictions for result evaluation create_evaluation_plots for creating evaluation plots create_evaluation_metrics_plot for creating detailed metrics plots create_umap_plot for UMAP visualization create_accuracy_plot for accuracy visualization create_confusion_heatmap for confusion matrix visualization
